intro: Meliosma laui var. megaphylla, commonly known as the giant leaf meliosma, is a variant of the meliosma plant characterized by its large, broad leaves. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often glossy and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters, making it a striking addition to tropical gardens. The botanical features of this variant highlight its adaptability to moist, nutrient-rich soils and its role in forest ecosystems.
